name: Dynamic Content for WooCommerce
author: Fuji 9

sections.description:
With this WordPress plugin, admins can use shortcodes on ANY page or post to restrict or show content to users based on the purchases they have made.

Let’s use a simple scenario. You are a store owner who is selling some low cost products along with some premium high end products. You have customers who come in and buy the low cost products, but you really want them to buy the premium products so you can maximize revenue! With this plugin, you will be able to identify users who have bought your low cost products and show them specific, unique content that only they can see.

And by the same token, you could also show specific content to your premium customers, offering opportunities and specials to purchase low cost addons.

However you want to slice it, being able to dynamically show and restrict content based on user purchases will help you streamline and grow your revenue generating online business.

And, that’s it! It’s that easy.

Support and Feedback

If you run into any issues or bugs, or if you need the plugin to do something it doesn’t, don’t hesitate to reach out to us: support@fuji-9.com. We’re always looking to improve our plugins in any way we can.

Change Log v1.1

  • Updated the plugin to support multiple product types.
  • If product is a subscription, it will check to see if the user has purchased it AND check if the subscription is active before showing the content
  • If it’s not a subscription, then it will only check if the user has purchased it
sections.installation:
If you want to install the plugin manually

  1. Upload the contents of dynamic-content-for-woocommerce.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

Once it’s active, you start using the plugin by following these steps:

  1. Edit any page or post you wish to display dynamic content on.
  2. Pick the product you want to associate the content with, and note it’s Product ID.
  3. In your content, you can use the following shortcode [f9_cc_shortcode product_id=”3215″] Your content goes here! [/f9_cc_shortcode]

You can put any type of content between those shortcodes: text, images, videos, other shortcodes.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

If you want to install the plugin manually

  1. Upload the contents of dynamic-content-for-woocommerce.php to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

Once it’s active, you start using the plugin by following these steps:

  1. Edit any page or post you wish to display dynamic content on.
  2. Pick the product you want to associate the content with, and note it’s Product ID.
  3. In your content, you can use the following shortcode [f9_cc_shortcode product_id=”3215″] Your content goes here! [/f9_cc_shortcode]

You can put any type of content between those shortcodes: text, images, videos, other shortcodes.

How do I show or restrict content based on purchases?

  1. Edit any page or post you wish to display dynamic content on.
  2. Pick the product you want to associate the content with, and note it’s Product ID.
  3. In your content, you can use the following shortcode [f9_cc_shortcode product_id=”3215″] Your content goes here! It will only be seen by customers who have purchased product ID 3215.[/f9_cc_shortcode]

You can put any type of content between those shortcodes: text, images, videos, other shortcodes.

short_description: A WordPress plugin that allows you to show or restrict content based on the purchases a user has made.

screenshots.caption: Using shortcodes, you can quickly and easily show or restrict content for your customers based on what they've purchased.
